featured_videos.editorial_title: Dairy Tolerance: How Much Is Too Much?
featured_videos.commentary: The dairy question keeps coming upâ€”and for good reason. Some people can drink a quart of milk daily without issue. Others break out after a single slice of cheese. It comes down to lactose tolerance, casein sensitivity, and your specific inflammatory triggers. This video addresses the "how much" question instead of treating it as all-or-nothing.

featured_videos.editorial_title: Extreme Challenge: What Your Body Can Handle
featured_videos.commentary: Okay, so this one's been trending hard. The concept hits that sweet spot between entertainment and genuine curiosityâ€”what can your body actually handle? The comments are full of people planning their own challenges. Classic community behavior: see something wild, immediately want to try it.

featured_videos.editorial_title: Ice Bath Protocol: The Cold Truth
featured_videos.commentary: Cold works. Period. But most people wing itâ€”jump in for "a few minutes" with no actual protocol. This breaks down the physiology: sympathetic activation, brown fat recruitment, recovery acceleration. Time matters. Temperature matters. Your training status matters.

The metabolic health conversation starts here. You can't outwork insulin resistance. You can't supplement your way around metabolic dysfunction. The foundation is understanding how your body processes energyâ€”insulin sensitivity, metabolic flexibility, substrate utilization. Get this right, everything else follows.

Budget and simplicityâ€”these are the real barriers for most people starting carnivore. You don't need ribeyes and exotic cuts. Ground beef, eggs, chicken quarters. Rotate proteins, batch cook, keep it sustainable. The fancy stuff comes later, once you've proven the basics work for you.

featured_videos.editorial_title: Keto vs Carnivore: The Real Difference
featured_videos.commentary: Two different tools. Keto maintains metabolic flexibilityâ€”you can still burn both fat and glucose efficiently. Carnivore removes plant-based inflammatory triggers entirely. The choice depends on your goals: metabolic optimization vs elimination protocol. Most people benefit from understanding both mechanisms.
